Through business transfers : In the event of a merger, acquisition, reorganization, sale of assets, financial due diligence, dissolution, bankruptcy, or similar, your information might be transferred to another entity.

As described in this Policy, we may share Personal Information with third parties and may be required to disclose information in response to lawful requests by public authorities, including to meet national security or law enforcement requirements.
How We Share and Disclose Your Information
We want you to feel confident in how we manage your data, so this Privacy Policy (" Policy ") outlines how we collect, use, and share your information as you use our website and our service (" Platform ").
With third parties : We store and process all of our data within a public cloud provider.

These platforms may use cookies to identify you and your sessions.
They may use " web beacons " (pieces of code embedded in the Platform that can track user activity), also known as " pixel tags ", and other tracking technologies to automatically collect information such as your IP address, geographic location, and how you interact with our Platform.
We also utilize analytics platforms such as Google Analytics to help collect information to improve the services we provide.
While using the Platform, we will use " cookies " (small text files that are sent to and from your computer) and local storage to store information pertaining to your current session.

Communicate with users and candidates : We use names and email addresses to be able to communicate with your candidates and keep them informed about calendar invites and any communication you want to relay to them.
